column4: Any ideas anyone about configuring Net-SNMP to report network connections?
do you mean a Cacti like setup?
I'm not sure what you mean. I want to be able to get the traffic values (as in ifconfig) through SNMP, i've done it before, just I dunno HOW!
cacti is an snmp-traffic management tool

Right, well what i'm trying to do is use Cricket (cricket.sf.net) to display network traffic.  For that I need SNMP, which is supported through the router-interfaces config.  I can do the cricket bit, it's just gettting SNMP to show data to start with!
::  give gkrellm a try  (gkrellm-snmp if im correct)
right idea, but I'm trying to log it all to RRDTool through Cricket

the rrdtool needs to be local and configured, maybe you need some MIB strings if they are nog provided yet. The RRDtool does the local collection through a cronjob (if memeory serves me right) and cricket is a sort of daemon with a web interface where you can view graphs
everything is fine EXCEPT SNMP.  It works fine on another box, except when I copy the config, it doesn't work!
there isn't anything in the way like a iptables?
also check if the local loopback adapter is up en running
I can get SNMP responses, just without the netowrk info
then I've got no clues left, sorry. It could be that the config is looking at a wrong adapter? (ath0 in stead of eth0 o eth1) ?
are you sure then that the config file is looking at the correct adapter?
It's not reporting ANY network data, none at all.  I get SNMP responses with snmpwalk, but no iFace stuff
check the config file of rrdtool and match that with the adapters listed in ifconfig
rrdtool extracts the data via SNMP, therefore SNMP needs to report the data!
